newsitem.title: GREECE: Athens bourse approves telecom OTE rights issue.
newsitem.headline: Athens bourse approves telecom OTE rights issue.

text.p: The Athens stock exchange cleared the 189.9 billion drachma rights issue of telecom firm OTE, it said in a statement.
OTE will issue 31,649,915 new common registered shares, entitling shareholders to six new shares per 80 outstanding at 6,000 drachmas each.
Shares of OTE will trade ex-rights June 18, but part-floated shares through last week's institutional book-building and public offering will not participate in the rights issue.

The Greek state offers retail investors with small shareholdings -- less than 100 shares -- the option to purchase up to an additional four shares in order to acquire a minimum trading lot of ten shares, it said.
OTE will use proceeds to finance network digitalisation investments between 1997 and 2000, it said.
